• iPhone 3.0 Push Notifications in Rails – use this new feature introduced on the iPhoneOS 3.0 (credit: Mike Gunderloy)
  • Git Practices – Confused? so am i, some good tips on Git practices from the guys at GitHub.. Now all they have to know is how to scale their service …..crickets
  • Pro Git book – Now available online.
  • Fun with Dates and CSS Sprites – i love those stuff.
  • Why acts_as_taggable_on_steroids was slow? – a lesson in database maintenance.

GitHub Treasures

  • github-token-fetcher – Get a user API Token instead of asking them to bring it to you.
  • TimeWarp – a gem that let’s you change your time (For tests mainly).
  • Looksee – Examine the precise method lookup path of any ruby object in ways not possible in standard ruby, which means, you can see which method came from which ancestor.
  • Pagify – a will_paginate replacement.
  • Decider – a ruby learning machine.
  • ActiveSocket – allows instant Service Oriented Architecture (SOA). ActiveSocket::Base extends ActiveRecord::Base, and over-rides only where necessary so that the actual model resides on the other side of a TCP socket connection.
  • Apache log parser in ruby – nice, better if it had some constant rules (:404_requests maybe).
